vehicle_metadata.title: National Science Foundation Reauthorization Act of 2026
vehicle_metadata.primary_committee: House Science, Space, and Technology Committee
vehicle_metadata.reauthorization_target: NSF authorization expires 2026 - must-pass vehicle opportunity

authorization_structure.primary_purpose: Reauthorize National Science Foundation programs and establish new research priorities
authorization_structure.funding_levels: Authorizes $12.5B in FY2027, increasing to $15.2B in FY2031

rider_1.title: Research Security and Foreign Influence Provisions
rider_1.content: Establishes requirements for disclosure of foreign funding and relationships in NSF grant applications
rider_1.rationale: Addresses bipartisan concern about foreign influence in research, fits naturally in NSF reauthorization
rider_1.controversy_level: LOW - bipartisan support for research security

rider_2.title: STEM Workforce Diversity Programs
rider_2.content: Authorizes $200M over 5 years for programs to increase participation of underrepresented groups in STEM fields
rider_2.rationale: Aligns with NSF mission, addresses equity priorities, relatively non-controversial
rider_2.controversy_level: LOW-MEDIUM - some conservative members may object to diversity programs

rider_3.title: Technology Transfer and Commercialization Acceleration
rider_3.content: Establishes streamlined processes for universities to commercialize NSF-funded research
rider_3.rationale: Economic development angle appeals to both parties, supports innovation economy
rider_3.controversy_level: LOW - broad support for technology transfer

authorization_advantages.must_pass_nature: NSF requires periodic reauthorization - vehicle will move
authorization_advantages.broad_support: NSF has strong bipartisan support, making riders less controversial
authorization_advantages.appropriate_venue: Science and research provisions fit naturally in NSF bill
authorization_advantages.multi_year_authority: 5-year authorization provides stability and planning certainty

committee_dynamics.primary_committee: Science, Space, and Technology - Chair supports NSF reauthorization
secondary_committees: Education and Labor - may claim jurisdiction over education provisions
Energy and Commerce - may claim jurisdiction over technology transfer
committee_dynamics.jurisdictional_navigation: Coordinate with other committees, offer to include their members' priorities in exchange for non-objection

funding_considerations.authorization_vs_appropriation: Authorization sets policy and funding levels; actual funding requires separate appropriations bills
funding_considerations.budget_impact: Authorization levels signal priorities but do not guarantee appropriations
funding_considerations.offset_requirements: May need to identify offsets for new spending, depending on PAYGO rules

timeline.senate_companion: Parallel process in Senate Commerce, Science, and Transportation Committee

stakeholder_coalition.research_universities: Strong support - reauthorization critical for research funding stability
stakeholder_coalition.scientific_associations: American Association for the Advancement of Science, disciplinary societies - full endorsement
stakeholder_coalition.industry: Technology companies support research funding and technology transfer provisions
stakeholder_coalition.education_associations: Support STEM education and diversity programs

opposition_risks.fiscal_concerns: Some conservative members may object to funding increases
opposition_risks.diversity_program_resistance: Portion of Republican caucus may oppose diversity-focused programs
opposition_risks.foreign_influence_provisions: Some research universities may object to disclosure requirements as burdensome

messaging.primary: Investing in scientific research and innovation keeps America competitive globally
messaging.secondary: NSF reauthorization ensures continued support for groundbreaking research that drives economic growth
messaging.rider_frame: These provisions strengthen research security, expand opportunity, and accelerate innovation - all core to NSF mission

disclaimer: Authorization vehicle strategy depends on committee relationships and broader legislative calendar. Rider inclusion requires negotiation and may face points of order on germaneness.
